com.pkmmte.pkrss

Class PkRSS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pkmmte.pkrss.PkRSS

  • public class PkRSS
extends java.lang.Object
    A powerful RSS feed manager for Android

    Use #with(android.content.Context) for the global singleton instance or construct your own instance with PkRSS.Builder.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PkRSS.Builder
      Fluent API for creating PkRSS instances.

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static PkRSS with(Context context)
        The global default PkRSS instance.

        This instance is automatically initialized with defaults that are suitable to most implementations.

        If these settings do not meet the requirements of your application, you can construct your own instance with full control over the configuration by using PkRSS.Builder. You may also use PkRSS.Builder.buildSingleton() to build the singleton or PkRSS.Builder.replaceSingleton() to replace the existing singleton if it differs.

      • getInstance

        protected static PkRSS getInstance()
        Returns the global singleton instance. It may be null so use wisely!
        Returns:
        Global singleton instance. May be null.

      • setLoggingEnabled

        public void setLoggingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Toggle whether debug logging is enabled.

      • isLoggingEnabled

        public boolean isLoggingEnabled()
        true if debug logging is enabled.

      • load

        public RequestCreator load(java.lang.String url)
        Starts a request with the specified URL.

        URLs may be anything you wish as long as the Parser and/or Downloader supports it. See PkRSS.Builder for using your own custom Downloaders/Parsers.

        Parameters:
        url - URL to load feed from.
        Returns:
        A chained Request.

      • load

        protected void load(Request request)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Handles the specified Request. May throw an IOException for mishandled URLs or timeouts.
        Parameters:
        request - Request to execute.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • get

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Article>> get()
        Returns a HashMap containing all loaded Article objects. The map key being the safe url.
        Returns:

      • get

        public java.util.List<Article> get(java.lang.String url)
        Looks up the specified URL String from the saved HashMap.
        Parameters:
        url - Safe URL to look up loaded articles from. May also be KEY_FAVORITES.
        Returns:
        A List containing all loaded articles associated with that URL. May be null if no such URL has yet been loaded.

      • get

        public java.util.List<Article> get(java.lang.String url,
                          java.lang.String search)
        Similar to get(String) but also looks for the search term.
        Parameters:
        url - Safe URL to look up loaded articles from.
        search - Search term.
        Returns:
        A List containing all loaded articles associated with that URL and query. May be null if no such URL has yet been loaded.

      • get

        public Article get(int id)
        Returns an Article object associated with the specified id.
        Parameters:
        id - ID belonging to such article.
        Returns:
        The Article associated with the specified id. May return null if no such article was found with that ID.

      • getFavorites

        public java.util.List<Article> getFavorites()
        Retrieves an ArrayList of articles from the Favorite Database.
        Returns:
        Either an Article List or null if database wasn't properly started.

      • markAllRead

        public void markAllRead(boolean read)
        Marks/Unmarks all loaded articles as read. This includes those loaded from all URLs and those stored in the favorites database. Those loaded after this was called will still be unread.
        Parameters:
        read -

      • markRead

        public void markRead(int id,
            boolean read)
        Marks an article id as read.
        Parameters:
        id - Article id to store its read state.
        read - Whether or not to mark this id as read.

      • isRead

        public boolean isRead(int id)
        Parameters:
        id - Article ID to check for its read state.
        Returns:
        true if such id was previously marked as read, false if it has not yet been marked as read.

      • saveFavorite

        public boolean saveFavorite(int id)
        Saves an Article object to the favorites database.

        If possible, use the Article object itself instead to increase performance!

        Parameters:
        id - ID of the article to save.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if otherwise.

      • saveFavorite

        public boolean saveFavorite(int id,
                   boolean favorite)
        Saves/Deletes an Article object to the favorites database.

        If possible, use the Article object itself instead to increase performance!

        Parameters:
        id - ID of the article to save.
        favorite - Whether to save or delete. true to save; false to delete.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if otherwise.

      • saveFavorite

        public boolean saveFavorite(Article article)
        Saves an Article object to the favorites database.
        Parameters:
        article - Article object to save.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if otherwise.

      • saveFavorite

        public boolean saveFavorite(Article article,
                   boolean favorite)
        Saves/Deletes an Article object to the favorites database.
        Parameters:
        article - Article object to save.
        favorite - Whether to save or delete. true to save; false to delete.
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if otherwise.

      • deleteAllFavorites

        public void deleteAllFavorites()
        Clears the favorites database.

      • containsFavorite

        public boolean containsFavorite(int id)
        Searches the FavoriteDatabase for the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - Article ID which to search for.
        Returns:
        true if database contains it or false if otherwise or database not yet started.

      • clearCache

        public boolean clearCache()
        Clears Downloader cache.
        Returns:
        true if successfully cleared or false if otherwise.

      • clearData

        public boolean clearData()
        Clears all PkRSS data including Downloader cache, all articles in Favorite Database, and all articles marked as read.
        Returns:
        true if successfully cleared or false if otherwise.
